questions.question: Which regulatory part applies to a hobbyist operating a small drone for recreational photography in a local park?

answers.text: Part 101 - this is a non-commercial recreational operation
Part 102 - all drone operations require commercial certification
Part 107 - research and development activities always require this part
No regulation applies to recreational drones under any circumstances

questions.feedback: Part 101 governs non-commercial recreational and educational drone operations. Since the hobbyist is flying for personal enjoyment, Part 101 applies.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the new Transport Instrument framework introduced in the December 2025 Part 101 updates?

answers.text: To replace Part 102 with a simpler certification process
To enable the CAA to respond dynamically to sector developments without lengthy rule amendments
To eliminate all regulations for drone racing and education
To restrict drones to only visual line of sight operations

questions.feedback: The Transport Instrument framework allows the CAA to issue targeted guidance and modify operational parameters more quickly than formal regulatory amendments.

questions.question: Which statement best reflects the reduced regulatory burden under the updated December 2025 rules for Part 102 operators?

answers.text: They no longer need any certification and can operate without restrictions
They face annual reviews instead of continuous approvals, and approved operators enjoy broader operational flexibility
Part 102 certification has been eliminated entirely in the 2025 update
They must now recertify every month instead of annually

questions.feedback: The updated Part 102 reduces regulatory burden through streamlined approval processes, performance-based standards, and periodic reviews with automatic renewal.

questions.question: A farmer uses a drone to monitor crop health and provide the data to their insurance company. Which part applies?

answers.text: Part 101 - crop monitoring is an educational activity
Part 102 - the operation provides commercial benefit to the farmer's business
Neither part applies because it's for personal agricultural purposes
Part 107 - agricultural monitoring always requires research authorization

questions.feedback: Part 102 is triggered by commercial benefit, not just direct revenue. The farmer gains commercial benefit through improved monitoring and reduced insurance risk.
